meanings.definition: A place where cream is made into butter and cheese.
meanings.sent1: The creamery was filled with the sweet smell of freshly churned butter.
meanings.sent2: I bought some delicious cheese from the local creamery.
meanings.sent3: The cows decided to start their own creamery and make butter all day long.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a creamery of ideas, churning out creativity at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The creamery hummed with activity as workers transformed cream into golden butter.

meanings.definition: A business that produces and sells dairy products.
meanings.sent1: The creamery down the road sells the best ice cream in town.
meanings.sent2: My family owns a small creamery that specializes in organic milk.
meanings.sent3: The creamery had a 'moo-velous' sale on all dairy products.
meanings.sent4: The creamery was a treasure trove of creamy delights waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the creamery was like stepping into a dairy wonderland of delicious treats.

meanings.definition: The act of operating a creamery.
meanings.sent1: Learning the creamery trade takes dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent2: She studied the art of creamery management to run her own business.
meanings.sent3: The creamery competition was fierce, but she was determined to succeed.
meanings.sent4: In the world of creamery, precision and skill are key to success.
meanings.sent5: His passion for creamery shone through in every batch of dairy products he produced.
